subject: Sales
title: The Reciprocity Trap
description: A fast breakdown of The Reciprocity Trap for builders.

hook.text: A vendor sends a nice gift before the meeting. When they ask a favor later, saying no feels rude.

buildup.text: Reciprocity is one of the strongest social forces. A small gift creates a sense of obligation.

discovery.text: Cialdini showed that even unwanted favors trigger the urge to give back. We can't help it.

twist.text: Skilled negotiators give concessions strategically. Each small give creates pressure for a big get.

climax.text: Accept gifts graciously but decide on merit alone. Don't let obligation steer the deal.

punchline.text: A gift before a deal is strategy, not kindness.

quiz.question: What makes reciprocity a 'trap' in negotiations?
options: Small favors create obligation to give back
